title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum (1 point each)

The following list is not exhaustive.

Abiotic factors (2 points maximum)

Light

Temperature

Water

Soil

Texture

Nutrients

pH

Wind

Periodic disturbances — fire/storms/volcanoes

Biotic factors (1 point maximum)

Reproduction

Predation

Food supply

Competition

Note: Nutrient can be abiotic or biotic depending on how it is used. Climate/weather/shelter are too general!

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
6 points maximum; 1 point each

Must relate to one of the two abiotic factors accepted in part (a) AND measure/relate to millipede distribution.

· Hypothesis — proposes a relationship between one abiotic factor and the distribution of millipedes.

· Prediction/expected results — states what should be observed if the hypothesis is supported. Can be in an “if ... then” format.

· Design — describes an experiment that manipulates one abiotic independent variable/factor.

· Constants — explicitly holds all other factors constant.

· Control — indicates a valid control group that serves as a comparison for experimental groups.

· Data collection — describes what observations will be collected or how they will be collected, or both.

· Sample size — indicates test of multiple millipedes or replicates.

· Statistical analysis — suggests a mathematical and/or statistical comparison of control and experimental groups or of observed and expected. A specific statistical test need not be mentioned.

· Feasibility — experiment could be performed and would yield data that would answer the question posed.

· Control — indicates a valid control group that serves as a comparison for experimental groups.

· Sample size — indicates test of multiple millipedes or replicates.

· Statistical analysis — suggests a mathematical and/or statistical comparison of control and experimental groups or of observed and expected. A specific statistical test need not be mentioned.

· Feasibility — experiment could be performed and would yield data that would answer the question posed.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum; 1 point each

Must be reasonable adaptation of experiment

· Modifications (up to 2 points) — description of the change(s) made.

· Control — description of changes in control group, if any.

· Explanation — why factor would affect a plant.

· Feasible design — experiment can be performed.
